solution_line_template: Bran's scholarship pays ${tuition_fee} x {scholarship_percent} = $<<{tuition_fee}*{scholarship_percent}={scholarship_amount}>>{scholarship_amount} to his tuition fee.
So, the total amount he still needs to pay is ${tuition_fee} - ${scholarship_amount} = $<<{tuition_fee}-{scholarship_amount}={remaining_after_scholarship}>>{remaining_after_scholarship}.
And Bran will be able to earn ${monthly_job_pay} x {months} = $<<{monthly_job_pay}*{months}={total_job_earnings}>>{total_job_earnings} after working for {months} months.

Therefore, the total amount he still needs to pay is ${remaining_after_scholarship} - ${total_job_earnings} = $<<{remaining_after_scholarship}-{total_job_earnings}={total_remaining}>>{total_remaining}.
